_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



ALDI operates a refrigerated warehouse facility in Moreno Valley, California.  As stated on the company's website, "At ALDI, we do everything possible from our carts to checkout to energy-saving stores to give you incredibly high quality at impossibly low prices".



ALDI management is not only committed to offer superior service, but to also maintain a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities.  ALDI's safety and environmental policies are administered by the Director of Warehouse. Periodic inspections of the facility are conducted by the facility's Director of Warehouse to ensure compliance, and oversees the entire safety and environmental programs.    These programs include forklift safety, hazard communications, lockout/tagout, Hazardous Materials Emergency Business Plan, employee safety manuals, manufacturer's documentation, Emergency Action Plan, as well as the Risk Management Plan.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



The ALDI facility is located at 12661 ALDI Place, Moreno Valley, immediately south of Interstate 60 and approximately twelve miles east of Interstate 215. The area immediately surrounding the facility is urban with a mixture of light commercial and industrial areas. The facility was originally constructed in 2015. The ammonia refrigeration system was brought on line in 2015. 



The primary business of ALDI is to provide storage and distribution of frozen food products, and produce. In order to conduct operations, the facility maintains a refrigeration system containing approximately 25,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia, a regulated substance.  The refrigeration system, consisting of piping, valves, and equipment, cycles ammonia through various physical states (high pressure liquid, low pressure liquid, low pressure vapor, high pressure vapor, and then back to high pressure liquid) in order to provi

de refrigeration for storage of frozen food products.  Typical operating conditions range from approximately 2 psig on the low pressure side of the system to 150 psig on the high side.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



In order to operate the ammonia refrigeration system, the facility complies with the CalOES California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program.



Administrative Measures:

The ammonia refrigeration system installation complied with the latest edition of the following codes and standards:



?    IIAR Ammonia Refrigeration Piping Handbook

?    IIAR Bulletin 109 Guidelines For IIAR Minimum Safety Criteria For a Safe Ammonia Refrigeration System

?    IIAR Bulletin 110 Guidelines For Start-Up, Inspection, And Maintenance of Ammonia Mechanical Refrigerating Systems

?    IIAR Bulletin 111 Guidelines For Ammonia Machinery Room Ventilation

?    IIAR Bulletin 112 Guidelines For Ammonia Machinery Room Design

?    IIAR Bulletin 114 Guidelines For Identification Of Ammonia Refrigeration Piping and System Components

?    IIAR Bulletin 116 Guidelines For Avoiding Component Failure in Industrial Refrigeration Systems Caused by Abnormal Pressure or Shock

?    ANSI/ IIAR 2 Equipment, Design, And Installation Of Closed Circuit Ammonia Mechanical Refrigerating Systems

?    ANSI/ASME B31.5 Refrigeration Piping And Heat Transfer Components

?    ANSI/ASHRAE Standard 15 Safety Standard For Refrigeration Systems

?    ANSI/ASHRAE Standard 34 Designation and Safety Classification of Refrigerants

?    ASME Boiler And Pressure Vessel Code, Section Viii, Division 1, Rules For Construction of Pressure Vessels

?    National Electric Code (NEC)

?    2010 CBC / 2009 IBC

?    2010 CBC / 2008 NEC

?    2010 CBC / 2008 UMC

?    2010 CBC / 2009 UPC

?    2010 Green Building Standards Code (Cal Green)

?    2010 Building Energy Efficiency Standards



The ALDI ammonia refrigeration system has many safety features.  Much of the safety of the system is inherent in the policie

s and procedures that govern the operation of the system.  For example, the ALDI facility operates in accordance with the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program.  It is important to note that the refrigeration system has been designed with several safety features to prevent the accidental release of ammonia.  For example, the compressors are equipped with safety mechanisms that will cause the units to shut down if operating conditions exceed designated safety limits.  Also, level indicators, alarms, and switches are installed in key points within the system to monitor the supply of liquid ammonia and to ensure that a vessel is not overfilled.



Engineering Measures:

Other safety features of the ammonia refrigeration system include: 

?    Emergency shutdown switch(es) that shut down all electrical components in the engine room.

?    Emergency Exhaust Ventilation System.

?    Ammonia Detection System integrated with an off-site alarm company.

?    Relief Valves with common discharge to a water diffusion tank.

?    Emergency Pressure Control System.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



This is a new installation; therefore, there is no accident history.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The facility has an Emergency Action Plan (plan) in effect.  This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:  



?    save lives;

?    minimize and avoid injuries;

?    protect the environment; and

?    minimize property damage.



ALDI  maintains a safety committee whose members are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility. The Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility.  This Plan is reviewed and updated periodically. 



ALDI personnel circulate throughout the plant, taking note of unusual conditions in any portion of the system.  In the event that an ammonia leak is

discovered, the person nearest to the leak will alert any personnel in the immediate area who are unaware of the danger, and the ALDI Director of Warehouse.  The Director of Warehouse will contact the Maintenance Manager and servicing refrigeration contractor to evaluate and ascertain the significance of the leak.  An outside refrigeration contractor is contracted to further assist in the potential repairs to the equipment pertaining to the ammonia system.  For major ammonia leaks, emergency agencies will also be notified as necessary as outlined in the Emergency Action Plan.  Action is promptly taken to mitigate the leak so normal operations can resume.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



A Process Hazard Analysis was performed in 2015 and 2020 at the ALDI facility.  These studies generate mitigation measures (recommendations) to improve safety at the ALDI facility located in Riverside, California. The mitigation measures include additional training, key maintenance-related tests/inspection, and enhanced emergency response policies and procedures.  These items are reviewed and addressed promptly.
